Team4450.Lib

Class AbsoluteEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • Team4450.Lib.AbsoluteEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource

    public class AbsoluteEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
implements edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource
    Provides a wrapper for the Absolute Encoder model MA3-A10-250N. That encoder is attached as an AnalogInput device and reads 0-5v for 0-360 degrees. Implements PIDSource interface so it can be a data source to the PID controller class.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAngle()
      Return the current angle of the encoder with zero offset applied.
      int getOffsetFromZero()
      Return the current offset angle left(-) or right(+) of the encoder with reference to the zero position (zero offset applied).

      Return current data source type.

      Return the current unadjusted angle of the encoder.
      double getVoltage()
      Return the current voltage of the underlying AnalogInput object.
      int getZeroAngleOffset()
      Return current zero angle offset.
      double pidGet()
      Return the current rotational rate of the encoder or current value (offset or angle) to a PID controller.
      void setPidOffsetMode(boolean enabled)
      Sets which angle value is returned to the PID controller, the angle from getAngle() or getOffsetFromZero().
      void setPIDSourceType(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSourceType pidSource)
      Set source data type to be returned by pidGet().
      void setZeroAngleOffset(int offset)

      • setPIDSourceType

        public void setPIDSourceType(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSourceType pidSource)
        Set source data type to be returned by pidGet().
        Specified by:
        setPIDSourceType in interface edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource
        Parameters:
        pidSource - Source data type. Only kDisplacement (angle) supported at this time.

      • getPIDSourceType

        public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSourceType getPIDSourceType()

      • setPidOffsetMode

        public void setPidOffsetMode(boolean enabled)
        Sets which angle value is returned to the PID controller, the angle from getAngle() or getOffsetFromZero().
        Parameters:
        enabled - True = use getOffsetFromZero(), false = use getAngle().

      • setZeroAngleOffset

        public void setZeroAngleOffset(int offset)
        Set the offset angle that represents zero. This value is added to the angle returned by the encoder so that the encoder reads zero when the wheel is pointed straight ahead.
        Parameters:
        offset - Offset angle 0-360.

      • getZeroAngleOffset

        public int getZeroAngleOffset()
        Return current zero angle offset.
        Returns:
        Zero angle offset 0-360.

      • getRawAngle

        public int getRawAngle()
        Return the current unadjusted angle of the encoder.
        Returns:
        Current angle 0-360.

      • getAngle

        public int getAngle()
        Return the current angle of the encoder with zero offset applied.
        Returns:
        Current adjusted angle 0-360.

      • getOffsetFromZero

        public int getOffsetFromZero()
        Return the current offset angle left(-) or right(+) of the encoder with reference to the zero position (zero offset applied).
        Returns:
        Current angle -180 to +180.

      • getVoltage

        public double getVoltage()
        Return the current voltage of the underlying AnalogInput object.
        Returns:
        Voltage 0-5v.

      • getRate

        public double getRate()

      • pidGet

        public double pidGet()
        Return the current rotational rate of the encoder or current value (offset or angle) to a PID controller. Only offset and angle implemented at this time. The use of the offset from zero point or angle from zero point controlled by setPidOffsetMode().
        Specified by:
        pidGet in interface edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PIDSource
        Returns:
        Encoder Current offset/angle or rate of change (not implemented).
